title: Other Countries Partnering Award [Australia] Understanding common mechanisms of pathogenicity in Mycoplasma species.
abstractText: Abstracts are not currently available in GtR for all funded research. This is normally because the abstract was not required at the time of proposal submission, but may be because it included sensitive information such as personal details.
findingsText: This grant only began in April 2014. So far we have engaged very positively with UTS in Australia. We have hosted a senior PhD student for 3 months enabling him to learn new techniques and take them back to Australia. We have applied for funding to the Australian government (ANR as collaborator). We have produced a joint poster for the 3rd Prato Conference on the Pathogenesis of Bacterial Diseases of Animals in Prato, Italy, October 2014. This won first prize. Finally, we have hosted Prof Steve Djordevic (named on the Partnering Award) at RVC for a research seminar and held useful discussions on future collaboration and research opportunities. Proteomic analysis of M hyo mutants at UTS. Agriculture, Food and Drink,Healthcare,Pharmaceuticals and Medical Biotechnology,Transport
